title: Drawing, "Alexander the Great Taming Bucephalus", ca. 1795
medium: pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Young Alexander standing in center holds rearing horse. King Philip seated at right. Seated spectators and standing soldiers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Alexander the Great Taming Bucephalus", ca. 1795.
ca. 1795. pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3367.
